events.name: Microsoft Tech Summit Singapore 2017 - Day 1
events.description: Day 1 of Microsoft Tech Summit Singapore 2017, a 2 day event hosted by Microsoft. You must register with the event to book your seat. Description: "Build your cloud and infrastructure skills with a two-day free technical training event." More information: https://www.microsoft.com/en-sg/techsummit/singapore.aspx Agenda: Monday, March 13 10:00 am-11:15 am - Tech Summit Keynote 11:30 am-12:45 pm - An Overview of the Microsoft Application Platform for Developers Make your app a native part of Office with Office Add-ins Modernize your Data Platform with SQL technologies Move all your communications to Skype for Business Online Powering IT Transformation with Office 365 Reinventing IT infrastructure for business agility Secure and manage your digital transformation The future is closer than you think; broadly deploying Windows 10 for business 1:45 pm-3:00 pm - Adopt holistic and identity-driven security with Microsoft Enterprise Mobility + Security (EMS). Azure SQL Database – The Intelligent Cloud Database for App Developers Configuring your heterogeneous environment with PowerShell and DSC Defend Windows clients from modern threats and attacks with Windows 10 security Deliver high scale and low cost solutions with Azure Tiered Cloud Storage Deploy and manage Windows as a service (Instructor Led Lab) Introducing Microsoft Teams Learn about the future of Microsoft PPM The benefits of running your SAP Applications on Azure 3:15 pm-4:30 pm - Administering Office 365 with PowerShell (Instructor Led Lab) Bring existing desktop apps to the Universal Windows Platform with the Desktop Bridge Connect your company with Yammer - a vision and roadmap update. Dive into the power of the Microsoft Graph API Drive transformative change with advanced analytics in Cortana Intelligence Suite and Microsoft RExplore the new, cross-platform .NET Core 1.0 Fix web app compatibility with Enterprise Mode Protect your business with Azure, a secure and trusted cloud Understand the future of software development in the cloud with the Azure Application Platform 4:45 pm-6:00 pm - Build modern cloud based web and mobile applications on Azure App Service Deploy Microsoft Office 2016 the right way Detect and respond to advanced and targeted attacks with Windows Defender ATP Discover what's new and what's coming to the SharePoint Mobile and Intelligent Intranet Explore Windows Server 2016 Security and Software Defined Datacenter Manage mobile productivity with Enterprise Mobility + Security (EMS).SQL Server 2016 Security (Instructor Led Lab) Take your management and security strategy to the cloud Understanding Cloud networking planning and troubleshooting with Office 365 6:00 pm-7:00 pm - Ask the Experts ****You must register with the event to book your seat**** Register here: https://www.microsoft.com/en-sg/techsummit/singapore.aspx For deeper engagement with Apache Apex, download, view past meetup webinars, slides, and docs.  To reduce time to market, look at operable app-templates that you can quickly import and launch.  Examples: HDFS-Sync, Kafka-HDFS, HDFS-Line-Copy, S3-HDFS and HDFS-Kafka. Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.
events.location: Marina Bay Sands, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore
events.group_name: Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data Apex Users Group, Singapore

events.name: Forgerock Identity TechTalk
events.description: Join us at the upcoming APAC Identity Tech Talk Series to network with like-minded peers and take part in friendly, informal talks on the latest digital identity tech - across apps, devices and connected things. REGISTER TODAY>> https://go.forgerock.com/APAC-TechTalks-Registration-2017.html Key Takeaways:- Get the inside story on new release features including dynamic cloud architectures, contextual authorization, consent & profile management and much much more- Develop professional skills and walk away with practical strategies/tactics about Customer Identity- Build and expand new connections over some brews and snacks with TechMates Allan Foster and Andrew Latham Hear the latest at the Identity Tech Talks: 4:00pm- Registration4:15pm- Opening Remarks4:20pm- Product Release Sneak Peek & Demo5:05pm- Discussion and Q&A5:30pm- Networking Drinks6:30pm- Event Closure Reserve your place as seats are limited and learn about the locations and more.>> https://go.forgerock.com/APAC-TechTalks-Registration-2017.html
events.location: Red dot brew house, 33/34 Boat Quay Singapore 049823

events.name: Productivity Workshop: Test-Driven Development Part Il
events.description:
TDD is a software development approach where a feature is built incrementally through the repetition of very short development cycles. In this approach, the process is started by turning a requirement into a specific test case, then code is written to pass the test, and then the cycle is repeated by adding a test for another feature requirement. Benefits of TDD include faster feedback, reduced scope creep and over-engineering, and modular and maintainable code.
This second day of the workshop will demonstrate the TDD approach in more depth.
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:45p - Introduce projects from members6:55p - Break out into groups7:00p - Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Spark Runbook: Learnings from 5 years of Spark for Analytics
events.description: Join our new organizers for the first meetup of 2017!  There will be a presentation titled Spark Runbook: Learnings from 5 years of Spark for Analytics, and we'll discuss how we can build out the Spark community in Singapore.  Please let us know what you want to get out of this meetup! 7:00 - 7:15 - Registration 7:15 - 7:45 - Presentation - Spark Runbook: Learnings from 5 years of Spark for Analytics Afterwards - Some of us may head over to Timbre+ next door for drinks and food. Special thanks to BASH for hosting this event!  BASH (Build Amazing Start-ups Here), is Singapore’s first, biggest integrated start-up space with the capability of congregating members and partners of the tech building community across the entire value chain of ideation, acceleration, incubation to expansion, all under one roof.  Read more about BASH here. Speaker Bio Han Xu is a technical lead at Palantir's Singapore office.  He joined the Palantir team at the beginning of 2015 in London, and has primarily worked on analytical products for trading and finance.  He began his career at the Financial Times in Beijing, then joined JPMorgan in Hong Kong as an investment analyst before joining Palantir. How to find BASH
events.location: BASH Singapore, Blk 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent

events.name: Book Club: From NAND to Tetris II – Machine Language & Virtual Machine I
events.description: Read The Elements of of Computing Systems and/or follow the Coursera course Build a Modern Computer from First Principles: From Nand to Tetris Part II.  This week we'll be covering chapter 7 VM I: Stack Arithmetic (week 1 of the course). It's going to be the first week of this new 7-week course (session starting on 13th March) so be sure to join us now and we can learn and push through the homework & project deadlines together. It's easier to complete such a course in a group. Trust us, we've done it. :)  "I did the coursework because understanding computers is important to me, just like literacy and numeracy, and I made it through. I never worked harder on anything, never been challenged to this degree. But given what I now feel capable of doing, I would certainly do it again. To anyone considering NAND2Tetris, it's a tough journey, but you'll be profoundly changed." Shimon Schocken, the author of the book talks about the course at TED: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iE7YRHxwoDs How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter and try out (better yet, complete) this week's course homework before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice!  FAQ Do I have to take Nand to Tetris Part I before taking Nand to Tetris Part II? From the Coursera course FAQ: "Nand to Tetris Part I and Nand to Tetris Part II are two separate and stand alone courses. Although it is recommended to take Part I before taking Part II, you can take any of these courses, in any order that suites you." Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS bookclub gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub Useful Links • NAND to Tetris website: http://www.nand2tetris.org/ • Get the book: http://www.amazon.com/Elements-Computing-Systems-Building-Principles/dp/0262640686/ • Coursera course: https://www.coursera.org/learn/nand2tetris2
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore
